meanings.definition: Showing a lack of intelligence or common sense.
meanings.sent1: His idiotic decision to wear shorts in the snow was not very smart.
meanings.sent2: It was idiotic of him to try to fit a square peg into a round hole.
meanings.sent3: The idiotic chicken tried to cross the road without looking both ways.
meanings.sent4: Her idiotic mistake cost her the game.
meanings.sent5: The idiotic idea of using a fork to eat soup made everyone laugh.

meanings.definition: Behaving in a silly or senseless manner.
meanings.sent1: The children's idiotic dance moves made everyone giggle.
meanings.sent2: She made an idiotic face to cheer up her friend.
meanings.sent3: The idiotic puppy chased its own tail in circles.
meanings.sent4: His idiotic jokes always brought a smile to people's faces.
meanings.sent5: The idiotic clown tripped over his own oversized shoes.
